title: Buying Missions is a Step in the Wrong Direction

The point is, however, one should not be forced into doing such convoluted means.

 If you have to default to Vs. AI to complete an event, and you're still competing with others to do so, then it wasn't well designed or thought out.

Buying "extra" missions via the passes is a completely legitimate and cheap way to earn extra loot. Those missions are specifically tied to Riven and Yasuo AND you can do both sides if you buy both passes. Each of those missions give you by default:

* 100 chaos/order tokens
* 1x chaos/order orb
* 1 hextech chest + key
* 1 nightbringer/dawnbringer ward skin

_**2 extra missions per pass give you:**_

 Novice mission
* Hextech chest + key, 40 tokens

Master mission
* 100 tokens, 1x gemstone
---
_**The total value of a pass is:**_

* 1 ward skin (640 RP)
* 240 tokens (506 RP)
* 1 orb (legacy skins chest with a 50% chance for bonus loot) - (295 RP)
* 2 hextech keys + chests (hextech set is 195 RP x 2 = 390 RP)
* 1 gemstone

Total cost of loot: 1831 RP (still not counting a Gemstone and double token boost on VS missions). That's a bonus of 531+ RP MORE than you payed for.

Your regular missions refresh after 24 hours so for the duration of the entire event, you should be given more missions and rewards to obtain on your own, with no actual cost to you.

I was on the fence about paying for missions, but when you put it that way, it's pretty high value. Especially when you consider how rare gemstones can be. So you are getting 1831 RP worth of stuff, PLUS something you CANNOT buy at all, plus the double tokens for any of the other event stuff you want to purchase (which includes key frags btw). And after hearing that you can do mission in Co-op Vs AI, I don't think it's that unreasonable at all. 

That said, I would like to see more variety of missions in the future--maybe some more specific or challenging--and have more of the event stuff like icons earnable directly from missions, but this is a fine first mission event.
